pull.title: p2p: rename GetAddresses -> GetAddressesUncached
pull.body: Rename GetAddresses to GetAddressesUncached to make it clearer that this function should only be used in trusted contexts. This helps avoid accidental privacy leaks by preventing the uncached version from being used in non-trusted scenarios, like P2P.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/32994.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [stickies-v](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32994#pullrequestreview-3025490230), [brunoerg](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32994#issuecomment-3085283292) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

Concept ACK. I would strongly prefer to go further and rename the trusted function to `GetAddressesUncached`. Overloads that behave vastly differently and can lead to dangerous behaviour is a big red flag for me.

I agree with @stickies-v. It's weird to have two functions with the same name but with a relevant behavior difference, renaming one of the functions seems appropriate. In any case, Concept ACK about improving the documentation.

verification.payload:
tree 690b740624b0b687b76b931852cec5271eabd78b
parent 184159e4f30c6846cd0324ee07b59e7f8121a5ea
author Daniela Brozzoni <danielabrozzoni@protonmail.com> 1752667143 +0200
committer Daniela Brozzoni <danielabrozzoni@protonmail.com> 1752842814 +0200

p2p: rename GetAddresses -> GetAddressesUncached

Rename GetAddresses to GetAddressesUncached to make it clearer that this
function should only be used in trusted contexts. This helps avoid
accidental privacy leaks by preventing the uncached version from being
used in non-trusted scenarios, like P2P.

events.message:
p2p: rename GetAddresses -> GetAddressesUncached

Rename GetAddresses to GetAddressesUncached to make it clearer that this
function should only be used in trusted contexts. This helps avoid
accidental privacy leaks by preventing the uncached version from being
used in non-trusted scenarios, like P2P.
